experience: You and Tony both know Eric Keosky-Smith, Trish Bear, and 93 others
Always a nice touch to receive a personal note from your College President. Thanks to the Phoenix Business Journal for covering the launch of our newly reformed agency.
Find out why I say no about 99 percent of the time to small event PR requests.

A PHOENIX / SAN DIEGO AGENCY KNOWN FOR CREATIVE RESULTSBranding + Marketing + Advertising + Talent Management + Social Engagement + PublicityWhat does it take to successfully run your company? Well, what do we know about the world's greatest civilizations? The Art, Science and Religion they left behind. These are the same components that make for a successful company. That's what we do for you. ART - Beautiful, pitch perfect design, moving pictures and compelling copy that tells your story beginning with the truth.  SCIENCE - All of the individual components in the marketing matrix that drives customers to you, makes them feel special and causes them to refer their friends and be loyal.RELIGION - Your devotion to your core values and your entire purpose for being on this planet and the reason why your company exists in the first place.

I serve as the Director of Communications managing strategic communications, public relations, media relations and social media.  I get to talk about Fried Fantasies, Baby Goats, Pigeon Rolling, Concert Dreams and Screams of Joy. If it can fit on a stick, I've likely done a story about it.
Tony Felice PR - CEO/CMO for Hire
Phoenix, Arizona Area, San Diego, California

Chief Marketing Officer or CEO for HireONE DAY - SIX WEEKS - A YEAR - WHATEVER IT TAKES Sometimes you don't want to hire an agency. Sometimes you just want someone to come in and fix everything. Or you need someone to evaluate what's wrong and make recommendations for improvement. I've owned an agency for 10 years and I've been helping companies be successful for more than 35 years.  I've been in business for myself long enough that I know what it truly takes to have staying power. I've seen my clients industry's go through so many things (recession, changes in consumer buying habits, pressures from the internet, etc.) that inform the choices we make for them. I've seen almost every gimmick there is and I know how to help you navigate one of the most complex systems: marketing.  My proven, proprietary method will transform your business and make your brand more competitive. My multiple decades career has taken me from the halls of the U.S. Congress to Hollywood California. I have worked on public policy, strategy and media relations for large multi-national corporations and small businesses alike. I've launched more than 90 brands in my career. Marketing is a systems problem requiring a scientific approach and elegant solutions.

A marketing and creative agency. We find elegant, creative solutions to systems problems. Marketing • Communications • Advertising • Social Engagement • Storytelling • Public Affairs • CausesOur Entertainment and Executive Division manages talent, develops entertainment people and properties and develops the personal brands of executives throughout the world.

recommendations: Richard Tirendi
CEO & Co-Founder
May 9, 2014, Richard was a client of Tony’s

It is nearly impossible to fully describe Tony Felice, his staff, and his company without appearing disingenuous.  Engaging Tony and TFPR may have been the single most impactful decision in our company's recent history.  Quite literally, from day one, the results obtained by TFPR exceeded every single unreasonably high expectation we had.  Tony is not just incredibly creative, he exemplifies integrity and has built an amazing team around him that possess these same rare and incredibly valuable qualities.  I have absolutely no trepidation in highly recommending Tony and TFPR to any company... they move mountains and make it look effortless.  I have referred many colleagues to TFPR and every one - without exception - has personally reached out to thank me for introducing them to Tony.  Final thought - I simply cannot imagine not having TFPR an integral part of our business endeavors.

There's a reason why Tyler is often named by news media as one of Arizona's most influential people. It's because her singular purpose in life is to make the world better through her own influence, good works and by connecting others to a purpose greater than themselves. There are talkers in this world, and there are do-ers and Tyler is a do-er.  She brings strategic thinking to every action and her eye is always on how to maximize the impact of whatever is before her. She has become a trusted colleague and a dear friend.  If I was a brand, I'd seek her out immediately to implement my CSR program. If I owned a charity, I'd hire her to maximize my development and granting efforts. Bottom line: hire her.

summary: Founder of the Felice Agency"One of 20 People to Know in Advertising & Marketing" -Phoenix Business Journal.  I'm an art school dropout who, after 25 years, graduated from the college of engineering ... and now I make art for a living. Go figure. But that's life. Find your passion and do it for a living. My passion is observing and then articulating what I've observed on behalf of my clients in beautiful ways that grow their business. I have the brain of a scientist and the heart of an artist.I've been in business for myself long enough that I know what it truly takes to have staying power. I've seen my clients industry's go through so many things (recession, changes in consumer buying habits, pressures from the internet, etc.) that inform the choices we make for them. I've seen almost every gimmick there is and I know how to help them navigate one of the most complex systems: marketing.  There is great power in the words we choose and the images we share and the story we tell. I get to do that for a living. That's incredible.My multiple decades career has taken me from the halls of the U.S. Congress to Hollywood California.  I've has worked on public policy, strategy and media relations for large multi-national corporations and small businesses alike.  I've launched more than 90 brands in my career.Appointed by Mayor Stanton, I'm a member of the Ad-Hoc Committee for FastTrack Cities, I'm a member of the American Institute of Architects Phoenix Advisory Council. I volunteer as Communications Advisor to Phoenix First Lady Nicole Stanton for her Dion Initiative, I'm on the Leadership Team of Focus On Lyme, an Officer of Local First Arizona's C(6) Board and I sit on the Pride Grant Advisory Panel for Arizona Community Foundation.  I was previously on the Board of Directors, Phoenix Art Museum Contemporary Art Forum, Chair and Vice Chair for the GPGLCC and I served on the Small Business Leadership Council of the Phoenix Chamber of Commerce.
name: Tony Felice
title: President at Felice Agency
